intro: Phyllitis linza, commonly known as the lesser water clover, is a small, herbaceous plant native to moist, calcareous soils in temperate regions. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant has a distinctive appearance with small, heart-shaped leaves arranged in a whorled pattern along its stems. Its flowers are small and white, typically appearing in clusters, and it is often found in wet meadows and stream banks. Phyllitis linza is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in wet environments.
